name: Activity feed
description: Tracks and displays recent activity across your VerifyWise instance. Shows project, risk, task, and vendor changes in a live feed.
author: VerifyWise
detailedDescription:
The Activity Feed plugin provides real-time visibility into changes happening across your VerifyWise instance. It automatically captures and displays activities for:

• Projects - creation, updates, and deletions
• Risks - new risks, status changes, and removals
• Tasks - task creation, progress updates, and completions
• Vendors - vendor additions, updates, and removals

The feed is displayed as a dashboard widget that shows the most recent activities with timestamps and user attribution.

maxActivities.label: Maximum activities
maxActivities.description: Maximum number of activities to store in the feed

faq.question: How far back does the activity feed go?
faq.answer: The activity feed stores up to 50 activities by default. You can adjust this in the plugin settings (10-200 range). Older activities are automatically removed when new ones are added.

faq.question: Can I filter activities by type?
faq.answer: Currently, the feed shows all activity types together. Filtering by entity type (projects, risks, tasks, vendors) is planned for a future update.

faq.question: Is the activity feed persisted across server restarts?
faq.answer: Yes, activities are stored in the database and will persist across server restarts. The plugin uses the metadata storage API to ensure data durability.

faq.question: Who can see the activity feed?
faq.answer: All users with access to the dashboard can see the activity feed. Activities show the user who performed each action when available.
